turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Why does he wanna see me?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Good question. Hardly sees anybody anymore. Hasn't left this place in twenty years. Did you bring some tobacco?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: He wants to know if you ever watch the Cookie Monster. He says the Cookie Monster is not to be trusted -- a trickster.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: But he is not unhappy with you because he knows you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He knows me?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: He says he saw you in a vision some time ago.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's he smoke in that?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Sacred herbs. Tobacco. Don't worry, we don't smoke no Mexican agriculture in The Pipe. That's a white man's myth. This is a sacrament.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: He said he doesn't know.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He just did the Gettysburg Address in Sioux. What did he say?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What was he saying?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Why should I tell you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Because he was talking to me.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: The old man saw an owl. Over there in the dry wash. Last week.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: And...

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: He saw an owl.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: The owl is a messenger. When one shows itself to a Sioux... it means someone's gonna die. The owl told him about Leo.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The owl told him about Leo. That's incredible. I guess we just broke the back of this investigation, didn't we? Evidence doesn't get any harder than that -- not for my money. Is there anyway we can seduce this owl into Federal Court?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: He also said "listen to the water."

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Listen to the water. Listen to the owl. He also said, don't trust the fucking Cookie Monster.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Go back to your DNA finger-printin'.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Don't be mad. That was just an old traditional gesture that means hello, how are you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I see. Forgive my cultural ignorance.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Jimmy didn't do it, Ray. I checked it out. You can stop taggin' my sister.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: She's your sister?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: So did this one. Wambli is a rare and sacred creature. When someone finds a dead one, the feathers get around the res. We share everything. A lot of power in the eagle feathers. But you think that's bullshit too, don't --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: -- Leo Fast Elk was sitting in the outhouse at Maisy Blue Legs when a car pulled into the yard. He came out, approached the vehicle then saw that the man behind the wheel was Jimmy. He tried to get back into the trailer, but the car came highballing at him. He started running for the open grass. With the car moving, Jimmy hung his shotgun out the window, took aim -- missed once, hitting the shitter -- fired again, and severed Leo's spine. Leo fell, rolled, and came to a stop in the grass. And some chicken feed. Stale chicken feed with four days mold.  Electromagnetic printing.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Was-te. 'Cept for one thing. Jimmy Looks Twice was nowhere near there. Ya see, when Jimmy was twelve years old, his mother and father was killed in a car wreck right down there near Elk Mountain.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't see the connection.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: The connection is, it did a head number on him. He's petrified of cars. Won't drive. I've known him all my life, and he's never gotten behind the wheel of a vehicle. He rides passenger and he rides horses, and that's it. The man that shot Leo down was behind the wheel of a moving car.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's not solid.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You want solid? That one, single, print he left in the Badlands -- the one the FBI missed and then stepped all over -- it belongs to a man who walks heels first. Like a white man. Jimmy has a serious Ind'n walk -- ball of the foot first. The man who murdered Leo walked like a Wasi'cu.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The old man? He's gonna tell you who killed Leo?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Go catch Jimmy, Ray. Really. He's gettin' away. Go ahead, go get him. I'm late.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey. Hey, those are my sunglasses you're wearing.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Grandpa traded with me.  Goodbye.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I can't do that,  It's a Rolex.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Red Deer Table, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't tell me: heavy duty.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Heavy, heavy duty. Taku Wakan. Wanagi Spirits. It's one of those few places we'd never go to as kids. Still don't. Some of the old people say Crazy Horse is buried back there. We have to go Ray. Together. Like his vision.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Walter. When I fill out my 302, do I say that evil spirits are killing everybody on the reservation?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Ray --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: -- no. No offense to the old man. I appreciate you trying to help. But I put my ass on the line coming out here, man.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: What'd you expect to hear?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Not Native American myths and legends. I'm with the FBI, Walter, remember? Not National Geographic.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: What you call myths, we call our history.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's not real.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: What's real to you? Wall Street? Capital Hill? Now they are myths.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I can't be dicking around here. That's all I'm saying. I don't carry crystals, I don't wanna come back in another life. I just wanna do my job, and do it right, and get the fuck outta here.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You ain't no Indian. You're a Sal Mineo Indian.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Take care of yourself, Walter.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Likewise.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Agent Little Weasel, Federal Bura of your Imagination.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Jesus Christ. You're hammered. What are you doing?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You're right about the old man. His power's long dried up. He's supposed to be a medicine man but he won't go see the people. He says we changed, and we don't listen. Well, he don't go out and talk no more. I haven't had a drink in three years but I just turned my sobriety chip into that man behind the bar, and this Hoss is gettin' watered.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cut the shit. You shouldn't be in here, Man.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Cuz I'm a skin?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cuz you're a cop.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Not no more.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You tell me. You tell me who went to the B.I.A. -- Bureau of Indian Annihilation and said I was messin' with your case, man. I don't give a goddamn about your case.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: And I don't give a goddamn about whether you wear a badge or not, Crow Horse, but I didn't cut you.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Still after Jimmy?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They found prints at Blue Legs' place.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Yeah. Jimmy's prints are there. But they cross over Benjamin Black Star's prints. And he wasn't there until six o'clock the mornin' after to get eggs from the chickens. So Jimmy wasn't there til the next day. Follow?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Next time I'll be ready. You get the word to who ever it is.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: I can't, Hoss. I don't talk to FBI's.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You think you was sent here cuz you're a good cop?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No. I was sent here cuz I'm Indian. And a good cop.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Five-hundred year old turtleshell rattle...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Crow Horse, listen --

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Where's Maggie? Where'd ya take her.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Nowhere. I'm trying to find her.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You got Jimmy. Let her go.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Crow Horse, listen. You have to come with me.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Why? So you can get rid of me, too?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No. So we can do what the old man said. Red Deer Table, Walter. We have to go.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Do they come in dreams, these visions?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Oh yeah. Dreams. Sometimes durin' sickness. Vision quest. Sweat Lodge. Ya never know when.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Just before we caught Jimmy... I had a dream that I was being chased. And I was running with other people. Old- fashion Indian people. I got shot in the back. Like Leo.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Where was this?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: At Wounded Knee. I mean, that's where I was, and that's where the dream was. Why?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You were running with the old ones. At The Knee. Heavy duty.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well, it was just a dream, I --

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Sonuvabuck! What's with you, Man? Who are you?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Nothin'. Forget it.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You had a vision. You had yourself a vision. A man waits a long time for a vision. Might go his whole lifetime and never get one. And along comes some instant Indian with a Mastercard and brand-new shoes, has himself a vision.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: I'm a full-blood Oglala.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We've driven a long way. Where is this place?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Maybe it was just a dream. Ya know, just one of them, what do ya call 'em, fitful dreams?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah. Fitful dreams.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Bullshit. You had a vision. You got sign from the old ones.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What the hell do you want me to do?!

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Stop.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Ain't prayer flags, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Jesus. Oil?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Uranium. Test holes. Somebody came in from the Nebraska side, and did some shotgun testin'. They're gettin' ready to suck this baby dry.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's what we're doing here. National interest. National security. Only this time it's not gold. It's uranium.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: We're standin' on broken treaty ground, Ray. This ain't supposed to be here. It'll poison the water.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Leo knew about it. Tried to tell Jimmy, get the Warriors involved.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: So they took care of Leo.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Listen to the water... the river keeps goin' down then rising again.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: This Clear Moon's house?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Yeah. It's time to beat the drum. You better wait here. He don't trust the white man.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Alright. Shit's comin' down. He's callin' council fire. All the old chiefs and the warriors, too. I gotta be at Grandpa's place in two hours. We need to get the tribe together. We need to block this thing.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What we need... is Richard Yellow Bird.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: I thought it was a rare case of a brother getting a break in the courts. We did an honorin' song for him and everything.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He's looking at a few hundred years in Leavenworth. He's not gonna come out without a fight.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Ray. Ray, don't let go now, Man. Ray...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You go to the council fire. I'm going back in.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Ray.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Ain't no Council Fire, Brother. Clear Moon...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I know. Come on. We gotta get off the reservation or we're dead.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Hoka Hey. It's a good day to die.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Bullshit, let's get outta here,

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He's gone.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: He hasn't left this place in twenty years. They got him.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: They got us sealed. What are we gonna do?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We're going for The Stronghold.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: That's it. The Stronghold. Get us in there, we got a chance.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We're in there. We're in there --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What about the water...

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You bought her some time, Kola. Ain't never gonna be over... but you bought her some time.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Some Indian time?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'll have to see what the visions say about that one.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You didn't have another vision...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You take care.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: If you ever need a place to come back to and listen to the trees a little... we'll be here.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You're the Indian FBI.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's right. Turn around.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: This Jimmy's?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You're not gonna catch him. He can shape-shift into different animals. Bear. Elk. Porcupine.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Is that like an hereditary thing, Magdelana, or can one take classes?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Jimmy didn't kill Leo. Why do you wanna do this?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He tried to kill him twice before. That's a good place to start don't ya think? Leo was on the other side, wasn't he?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: -- Leo was an apple, that's right. Red on the outside, white on the inside. And Jimmy hated him. Kicked his ass a coupla times. But he didn't kill him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Who did?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You're the FBI. That's your job, isn't it? Ya know how many of our Warrior brothers got killed out here? I never saw any investigating then. Why now? What's going down here?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: A Fugitive Alert for a murder suspect. Before somebody else gets a shotgun blast in the spine.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Try the Fort Laramie Treaty. All over again.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Look. You and I can stand here in a culture clash til the sun comes up, talking about what's right and what's wrong. You're from the reservation. It's a different world.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: I'm from Minneapolis. Fifth Street. I did four years at Dartmouth before I ever set foot on this res. So I know about the other world, Ray.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: When you see Jimmy, tell him the sooner he turns himself back into a human being and gives himself in... the sooner we back off this reservation. Okay?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Grandpa Reaches says you come from heavy Indian blood. I used to think Grandpa was gettin' senile. Now I know he is.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Move it, Magdelana.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You burned an American flag today. And left it for me...

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: -- You desecrated it, it had to be burned.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I desecrated it?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: You forced an innocent man to run like an animal. You've tried to poison my people's hearts against me with your manipulation, with letters I never wrote... you've been watching me eat, work, raise my family... wash myself in the river. And now you're here, arresting me at a sacred place.  In your eyes, that's power.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Your relatives must've taught you something.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: NO.  My father never told anybody he had Indian blood. But he still used a few Indian words around the house. He called me Washee. Said it meant... good boy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Wa-shee is like... a dumpling. Like tallow we put in stew. I think he was calling you chubby boy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: X21, give me a 20.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Black Tail District, X22. You ready for this? Leo wasn't killed in the Badlands. I... I found the location.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: X22. Read.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Go ahead, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I have a pick-up truck. No plates. Subject -- Indian -- entering suspect's house. Over.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Okay, Ray. I'm coming in. If he starts to leave the area, move in. And hold him. Over.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No plates. No registration. Serial numbers removed. And all prints washed off by the river. That's great. This is turning out to be a walk in the park, do you know that?

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Come back?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Never mind.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Ray. X22.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I read, Cooch.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Remember that upside down flag back at Jimmy's house? Somebody took it down.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: They took it down, set fire to it, and threw it on the doorstep of room 13 at the Buffalo Butte Motel. Your room.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: X21. Come back.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Ray. What's your 20?

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: What are you doing on the reservation?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm on my way back in. Over.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yellow bird... is gonna sing.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Yellow Bird committed suicide at three o'clock this morning. Some gung-ho agent from D.C. pushed him into a corner. You're playing a losing game. Pull over.

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: Ray...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Mister Tully.

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: Do you want a coffee?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No. No, no. Thank you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not that sure. Yeah, I think --

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: -- yes, Teton Sioux. Father's side.

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: With an Indian representative out there, we hope to keep hostilities dormant; this is a COINTELPRO, Selective Operations Unit, and it'll be easier on Agent Couture if you can gain the people's trust and maybe --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Woh, excuse me, Sir... I see what you're saying... I've got a little Indian blood, that's true. But --  I am not an... an Indian. I can't just go in and --

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: -- your father was part Sioux.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: What ya want?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Must be a bitch getting around in that wheelchair. How long you been in it?

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: Since I got a iron pipe put across my knees, man. Fight with three wasi'cus, ya know.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: At Sioux Falls Pen?

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: No, that was Leavenworth. This --  was Sioux Falls. What ya want?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Leavenworth a tough joint?

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: You ever try solitary confinement?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No. Can't say that I have, Richard. Richard do you know why I'm here?

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: Washington sent ya. I know that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yes, Washington sent me, Richard. They sent me here because this whole thing has been fucked. Do you know what I mean when I say this whole thing has been fucked, Richard?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Not for long, Richard. You got early parole under the stipulation that you would help us in a situation, and you didn't deliver.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: What the fuck you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Get up out of the chair, Richard.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: What's with you people? Why do ya have to fuck with my head all the time? I came through, man.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Get up out of the chair, and walk toward the backdoor, Richard.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: I get thrown in solitary until I don't know my own fuckin' name, and then you people tell me I can beat nine years if I help you. I helped you!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Get up!

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: They said I'd never see FBI again, and I'm livin' with you fuckers. I don't feed ya information on the Warriors, it's back to the pen. I don't do this, back to the pen. Your word against my word. Against a con Indian's word. I really got a chance, man, right?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They sent me here, Richard because they said you didn't hold up your end of the arrangement, and I have to transport you back to Leavenworth.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: What the fuck, man? What do you people want? I did what you wasi'cu's told me to do.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Leo Fast Elk... is alive.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: No way. No fuckin' way.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How the hell do you know?

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: I blew his back out with a buffalo gun, that's how I know! Now you're gonna say I didn't, so you can throw me back in solitary?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The men who came to see you at Leavenworth. The one's who made the arrangement... who were they? Maybe I can talk to them.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: Miles. Three other suits. That's all I know 'em as -- suits. Were you there?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You turned Leo over on his face. But the coyotes must've turned him back over, man, cuz his spirit is out. It's out, and it knows.

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: What do you know about spirits? You ain't no In'dn.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Leo knew something heavy and was trying to tell Jimmy. But you must not know how serious it was or you would have delivered. Do you realize what Leo could have told Jimmy?! Do you?!

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: I took him out before he got the chance. He didn't say nothin' about Tashka Sha. And now his spirit is in the dirt. Forever.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's Tashka Sha, speak English, speak English!

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: Red Deer Table! What's with you, man?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Keep talking, Yellow Bird...

turns.speaker: YELLOW BIRD
turns.text: All I know... is I did what I did... and I ain't in solitary, gettin' pumped up with downer, gettin' beat to shit. But I tell you what, Suit. Take me back. Cuz I can't take this shit no more.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'll bet!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Uhhh...Anything I can do for you? She laughs again, doesn't know what it is...could be chemical, but she's instinctively attracted.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yeah. Hold this. It might be safer.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Now I know why all the girls come here. They know how horny you guys get. But this...is ridiculous.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It's not that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It isn't?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Well, it is. It is that, too.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That's a big comfort to me.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I could be, too.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Save you from a big mistake with that other guy.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: And on to a bigger one with you?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Yeah, most likely.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Was there ever a girl who didn't like fighter pilots?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I heard of one once.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Can I walk you out?She turns back to him, a smile.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm with someone.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I thought he'd never leave.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yeow!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Everybody's got to be somewhere.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What if Captain Dawson had come with me?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It would have been really embarrassing!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How did you know this was my car?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Simple deduction. It's fast. It's pretty. Sleek and stylish...It's your color...matches your lipstick.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That's all!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: And I asked someone. CHARLIE You think you're pretty smart.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I beg your pardon.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: No, I beg yours. But I don't think you're right on that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I saw one.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You saw a MiG 21?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I saw a MiG do a 4 G negative dive.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Where did you see that?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It's classified.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's what?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It's classified. Like Hollywood says, I could tell you, but then I'd have to kill you.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Lieutenant, I have a top secret clearance. The Pentagon sees to it that I know more than you.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Not in this case. CHARLIE  You saw a MiG push negative 4G?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: On his six.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: He was in a 4G Negative dive and you were on his six?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Yes, ma'am, At first. Then I was directly above him.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: If you were directly above him, how did you see him?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I was inverted.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Two miles.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Two meters.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You know. The finger.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It never came up.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You let me make a fool of myself.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You seemed determined to do that anyway.. Why didn't you tell me you were a famous MiG insulter? MAVERICK Would it have made a difference?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: What would?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You know, I'm assigned to this school. I see sixteen new hotshots every eight weeks. Your attention is flattering, but not really productive. Why don't you keep your mind on flying.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: What would you say, too fast...too quick...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: And far too aggressive.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It is combat. Every second counts.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Well, what you need...what you have to keep looking for...what you want to get is a wingman who can stay up with you. Who can match you move for move. Then you've got something.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: That stuff about the MiG. I was out of line.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Apology acknowledged.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Is that all? CHARLIE What else do you want?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Um. You.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: There you go with those moves again.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Too aggressive?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I don't mix with the boys. I work here. Let's keep it professional.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I'm special.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yes. I'll give you that!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Give me a break, I'm asking you out.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I thought there was something... That night in the club...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Lieutenant...

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Evan... or Maverick.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Maverick...you know the rules of engagement.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Some one comes up hot on your six, what do you do?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You turn into him, check him out, identify friend or foe.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I'm not your foe. CHARLIE And if he's harmless, you disengage.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Harmless!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Uh hum.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: What if he's not?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You have to shoot him down....If he's smart, he'll turn away before that happens.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: And probably never again. It's nothing personal. It's just...I know a lot of pilots. Maybe I'm immune...

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Don't worry, I'm a new strain. And I don't give up. Everything I've ever wanted I've had to work like hell for. Well, how about it?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How about what?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: How about anything, anything you want to do.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hard to argue with that, isn't it...

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: A date... Coffee... A drink...A walk in the park.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What about the plane?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: What plane.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Most of them invite me to sit in the cockpit...play with the levers and things. MAVERICK Well, get used to it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Used to what?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I'm different.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm starting to sense that now.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Let's make it at eight.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Make what?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Anything.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Okay, anything. Just...go. I've gotta work.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Why'd you do that?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It dies. We live.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're an animal.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: That's true. What are you?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I don't enjoy watching things suffer.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It's not suffering anymore.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're horrible

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You're not, cause you eat frozen meatballs?    Things die. Every time you breathe, you kill millions of tiny organisms. Every time you eat, something had to die.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You don't have to kill it.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Somebody does. It's more honest this way. You do your own dirty work.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You ever think about killing another human being?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: About as much as they think about killing me.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Does it bother you?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: They know the rules... That's the deal. That's why you're up there. It's him or me. That's the price of admission.  It bothers you, why? You're part of it.   Everybody dies. Most people don't get to die for something.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You know what really scares me? Living too long. Losing my hair and my teeth...and my guts and my wind. And my brains...Sitting in a room with my hands in my lap, watching daytime TV.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You don't believe any of this. You don't think you'll ever die.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: That's it, of course. When I'm up there and doing it, I'm cheating it every second. I'm subverting all laws...gravity...whatever. I'm skating the edge of it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Winston Churchill.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What he said..."There's nothing so exhilarating as being shot at without result."

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: All you've got is one life. I guess it's worth about the same to every body. You ever see an old woman after her husband has died? And the meaningless years of decline stretch ahead...  When you're in the air and doing something really dangerous, you can look ahead... maybe ten seconds. That's your whole future. That's as far as it goes. But imagine what those seconds are worth.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What if you kill yourself? Think of everything you'll miss. MAVERICK There is lots of stuff I don't know about...  Fine wine... great art... the opera. I guess if I live long enough, I'll get to it. If I don't, I'll never miss it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Are you really that brave?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I watched my mother die. Cancer. She had a long time to think about it. They say you reach an agreement with death. Come to accept the fact that pretty soon you won't be here. I didn't see that. She... was very brave...braver than I am. You go up there, there isn't time to think. If you make a mistake, you're just a smudge on the ground. Simplifies funeral arrangements.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's just as I thought.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're totally insane.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Thanks very much.  Care for some suchi?.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You want to go ballistic?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I don't know. I don't like being out of control.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I always wanted to fly... ever since I first saw a jet. I wanted to fly jets, then I wanted F-14's, then I wanted to fly off carriers, then I wanted Top Gun.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: And now?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: And now I want you.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You always get what you want?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I don't know yet.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I want it understood.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Anything.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No fooling on base, no signs, no comments, no talk. By anyone.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm a professional. You guys are in my line of work.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Food...and you...my F-14!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: In that order?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Well no...inverse order.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm still second best.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You ever fly an F-14?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I don't fly in anything that doesn't show movies.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Danger?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: . Yeah!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Doesn't it ever bother you?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Why, what's gonna happen?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Lucky charm.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What do you take me for? It's a Navy Cross.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Just good luck.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Where'd you get it.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Pawn shop. What's to eat?
